thread.title: Here's the James White touchdown that won the Super Bowl for the Patriots
thread.title_full: Here's the James White touchdown that won the Super Bowl for the Patriots

author: Alex Kirshner
title: Here's the James White touchdown that won the Super Bowl for the Patriots
text: Here's the James White touchdown that won the Super Bowl for the Patriots The best Super Bowl maybe ever ended on this play. Rec The New England Patriots won their fifth Super Bowl on Sunday night, completing a 25-point comeback against the Atlanta Falcons with a James White 2-yard touchdown run in overtime. By NFL overtime rules, the Patriots’ touchdown meant Atlanta didn’t get a counter-possession, and the game was over. The game will go down as one of the best Super Bowls in the event’s 51-year history. New England fell behind 21-0 and then 28-3 by the third quarter, looking more disheveled than ever. Atlanta seemed primed to waltz to a win. New England’s 25-point comeback that forced overtime started with about 17 minutes left in the game, on a James White touchdown grab. That turned out to be the first of four consecutive New England scores in the run-up to overtime. The last was a Danny Amendola touchdown, followed by a White two-point conversion, that knotted the score at 28 and brought about the first overtime in Super Bowl history. The NFL’s treated fans to lots of terrible games this year, and in these playoffs. This was the grandest exception the league could’ve possibly asked for. In this Storystream
